headline: Classic Minute® Rice Pudding
description: Here's our favorite and most requested rice pudding recipe! Everyone will want to taste this classic dessert with dinner!
name: Classic Minute® Rice Pudding

recipeInstructions.text: Combine milk, rice, sugar, raisins and salt in medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer 6 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Beat eggs and vanilla lightly in a small bowl. Stir small amount of hot mixture into eggs. Stirring constantly, slowly pour egg mixture back into hot mixture. Stirring constantly, cook on low heat 1 minute until thickened. DO NOT BOIL.
Remove from heat. Let stand 30 minutes. If desired, sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve warm. Store any remaining pudding in refrigerator.

review.reviewBody: Perfect!
Its dang good! Instead of using refrigerated milk I used 1 cup half n half and powdered milk for the rest. Didn't change anything else. I don't see the pudding making it thru the night.
Fire
I used 1 1/2 cup of rice, 18% table cream, 1 1/2 cup of sultana raisins, 3/4 tsp. cinnamon, 1tsp. vanilla. It turned out lovely.

So good! I used 4 cups lactose free 2% and 2 cups almond milk and really had to whisk fast to keep the eggs from scrambling but I probably could have let it cool down more. I was worried it wouldn't thicken up with the milk subs so I brought it to one more boil after adding the egg and it turned out amazing!
Amazingly delicious. Just like from the Ambrosia rice pudding in England!
Omg!
I have added 1/4 tsp or 1inch of tubed ginger

Fantastic recipe! Mine came out a little softer than I would have liked so maybe next time add another egg. (I doubled the 4 serving recipe so it would be 5 eggs not 4) also I didn’t have vanilla because I’m poor so I used extra cinnamon and a bit extra sugar.
Great taste. Did not thicken as much as I would have liked. Put it baclkon low heat which helped a little. Maybe a little less milk next time?
It turned out awesome, first time my daughter helped me cook dessert. Amazing, everyone liked it!!!!! Easy to do, instructions were easy to follow.
My Mother always made delicious rice pudding when we were kids. This was my very first attempt ever!! Easy and delicious. Actually thought she made it soooo good.Thank you!

Are use 2 cups of milk and one cup of heavy whipping cream. I didn’t have raisins so I added more sugar and doubled the vanilla. I’d like to try it with raisins next time and have enough milk to make it without milk.
Perfect. Make it per the recipe. Perfect.
Very good. Just the right sweetness. Added 1/4 cup raisins and added a touch of nutmeg.

Super easy and good. I wanted to make this for a quick treat late night. Ran out of vanilla so I used almond extract and coconut extracts. Wanted more custardy so used two eggs and an extra yolk. Perfect and satisfying.

It took a while to thicken up. I think they suggested too much milk. The rice was not crunchy, but it was not soft either. Otherwise, it tasted good! If I choose to make this again, I would use less milk.
No changes and it didn't last long.
No changes and it didn't last long.
This turned out very good! I used the recipe as a guide since I made a few changes. I used leftover cooked Minute Rice and two cups of milk. The consistency was just right for my family.

This is just like my grandm used to make for us, o remembered the ingredients but wasn't sure of the order to put it together, i added more sugar than it called for but thats because i remember her using a cup of sugar, and i didnt add raisins to it, i cant wait to make this again when my grandsons are over, thanks for sharing, this brings back so many memories of grandmas kitchen

I loved it! Been searching for the right price pudding recipe for years so glad I found this one. It's always a hit. I sometimes use less raisins. And I use 1/2 c sugar. I've only had med size eggs before and used 2 turned out just the same. Great recipe and super quick and easy!
Cooked with 3 cups almond milk and 3 tbs of pure maple syrup
easy peasy, turned out great
Pretty good. I'd put 1/2 cup of raisins and use half a day half instead of milk next time and add Cinnamon up front. Otherwise food recipe.
This was a great base recipe. I added more raisins and vanilla than called for but otherwise it was fantastic!
Really nice, a tad too sweet, recipe is a keeper, next time I’ll use less sugar.

I have tried so many rice pudding recipes and been disappointed, but this one is awesome! It took me a few times to get it perfect, best advise, go slow, even though it’s a quick recipe, I just give it time. I cooked the rice till it was done then added the sugar, the sugar seems to change the cook on the rice. I doubled it, but went down to just one egg, and put twoTBSP brown sugar & two tbsp butter in with the egg. I wanted it more creamy, less custard’y, and I like sweet, but I also taste it to make sure it’s rite for me first.
We're Greek and we were raised on rice pudding but it is so cumbersome to make the old fashioned way! This is quick, easy and tastes just like my Yiayia (Grandma) used to make!
I love rice pudding, and this was so easy ! I think it is the best rice pudding I have ever made!
This was so easy! I used leftover minute rice and Stevia. Just like mama used to make. Will definitely make it again.
I reduced the milk to 2.5 cup. So it resulted in more creamy and thick pudding. Also I reduced the amount of sugar to half of it, it is healthier and less sweat. I like this recipe! Perfect !

This was incredible! I will definitely make it again. I was never a fan of Rice Pudding but this is the creamiest, sweetest Rice Pudding ever!! I did simmer it longer than the 6 minutes it stated just to thicken it up. You'll know its done while your stirring it often. When adding the egg/vanilla mixture you HAVE to stir it in quickly to turn it into a custard like consistency . This was the most delicious rice pudding I've ever had.
My first time making rice pudding, came out great! I omitted the cinnamon and raisins, and it's perfect with just the sweet vanilla flavour.
Won't be making this again
the only changes I made, was I cut the recipe in half. awesome recipe. def will make again. ty
Very good rice pudding recipe. Will definately make it again.
I've made this several times. The only change I make is to move some cinnamon in right at the beginning.
Very easy and very good. My first time making any kind of rice. Definitely will make it again.

This rice pudding turned out with the rice still pretty hard and not pudding-like. I'm not sure where I went wrong with this recipe as I followed it to a T (except for the raisins because I don't care for them). In fact I cooked the rice for a little more than the recommended 6 minutes as I could tell it wasn't done. After I was done adding the egg, the rice still didn't look quite done but I thought it might soften up while it stood for 30 minutes - nope. When I came back after 30 minutes, the rice pudding had formed into a hard ball-like shape in the pot. To try to salvage it, I added another cup of milk and stirred, and more milk afterwards too. Still on the hunt for the perfect rice pudding recipe...
Simply Delish!

Mostly followed it, making my own changes and replacements and it turned out great! I used cashew milk instead of regular milk, added the raisins but also shredded coconut, mixed the vanilla in with the rest of the ingredients and skipped the eggs because I'm stick to a mainly vegan diet and quite frankly I think it's just added calories as mine thickened without it - to each their own :) . 
Awesome receipe and step by step!

The taste is amazing but I took a star away bc the tempering of the eggs was waaaay off. You must add enough hot mixture to the eggs to bring them up in temp to add to the rest of the pudding or else the eggs cook! The instructions just say "add a small amount of hot mixture" and that just doesn't cut it. I would like to spare someone else from the same mistake if possible. I also added a little extra sugar and no raisins and it is amazing. I've made it every day for a week now.

Delicious and simple! I substituted 1C. of unsweetened vanilla almond milk for 1 of the cups of milk, used half raisins, half craisins (it's all I had on hand), used half brown, half white sugar, and added a dash of nutmeg. This was easy and oh, so good! Be patient with the eggs! I added mine too quickly and a tiny bit of the whites cooked. It didn't affect the flavor or texture, but it wasn't as pretty. Thanks for this recipe!!
Made it with soy and it turned out great. Would have added cinnamon during cooking but it was so good and simple

I did not add rasins but instead added 1 tsp banna flavoring to the cooking rice it turned out really amazing. Definitely will make again! :)

Thickend up nicely
Num yummy. Very good traditional taste.

I gave it five stars due to the ease of the recipe and the enormous amount of flavor these simple ingredients created. Followed it almost to the tee but added a dash of nutmeg and cooled it prior to serving. Sprinkled cinnamon and sugar after I scooped it in the bowls. The family thought it was great.
Make this all the time it's super good and really easy!
Easy to do

This is so good! I have been trying for years to find a recipe that tastes like the rice puddings at the Greek restaurants and this is it! Only thing they do is garnish it with sprayed whipped cream and cinnamon. Rice pudding really is a formula recipe like baking. Follow this recipe verbatim. I used golden raisins, my preference, and 2% milk as my only minor deviations. Do not use non fat milk, artificial sweeteners, or regular rice, and expect this to turn out thick and creamy. I made sure not to boil it at the end, as stated, so it did not separate. It stayed pudding like with that suggestion. Unless one eats large desserts, I would say this is probably closer to 5 servings. This one is being saved in the recipe box, for future rice pudding cravings. ty

Love it! I can't stand raisins so I subbed with rough chopped walnuts. I followed the directions to a T, but ended up cooking the egg a tiny bit when I added it, BUT that's because I'm impatient and hungry and it smelled SOOOO good I NEEDED it! Sooner rather than later so... Yeah it's gone now. Taste like yum. ^-^
good but did not thicken
The family loves it
Easy to make, didn't use raisins, turned out great.
For a quick treat, this is very yummy!
Absolutely wonderful!! Sorry Kozy Shack, this is much better, much cheaper & so easy & quick to make!! A family fave!!
I have to admit I have a bad habit of trying new things and making changes but I behaved and stuck exactly to the recipient and it turned out amazing!!!! Love it!!

I like the taste but I like more cinnamon, just a preference thing.
it turned out creamy like it should. I used a 0 calorie sweetener.
I can see eating some for dessert, snack, or even breakfast. Hot or cold. thanks, and Happy cooking!
Very delish! And was a snap to prepare. I used soy milk. Added a hint of vanilla instant pudding. And added cinnamon to the egg mixture. Enjoy!!!
My mom used to make this when I was young. So glad I found the actual recipe because I tried to do it from memory, and while it was close...it wasn't quite right. Now, it will be perfect.
Pretty darn good...especially after replacing 1/2 the milk with rice milk and adding the cinnamon in with the eggs. Delish!

Made this recipe tonight. It tasted really good rice a little chewy gonna try to add more milk next time. The only thing I changed was I added the cinnamon and vanilla at the end when it started to thicken up.
